other_tests.findings: Resected specimen contained a well-circumscribed adrenal adenoma expressing P450c17.
other_tests.changes_over_time: After surgery, hypokalemia improved gradually without medication, and weight gain stopped.

other_tests.findings: Demonstrated high uptake by the left adrenal tumor, while the right non-tumorous adrenal showed markedly suppressed uptake.
Revealed uptake in the skull and ankle joints, as well as both femoral heads (more prominent on the left).
Showed irregular low signal intensity of both femoral heads on T1- and T2-weighted images, typical of avascular necrosis.
Baseline iPTH value was 770 pg/ml, post-ischemic value was 716 pg/ml, indicating that the autotransplanted parathyroid gland was not causing secondary hyperparathyroidism.
